post_text: This week in Mrs. Jones's 8th grade ELA classes, student participated in lively debate after reading part of The Giver. Philosophical Chairs is just one of many strategies used to help students develop critical thinking skills, debate skills, and listening skills. In Philosophical Chairs, students are given a statement with which they either a agree, disagree, or are undecided. At any point in the debate a student may change sides. Students must listen and before responding must summarize what they just heard. It is a favorite activity in this classroom!

The Girls Leadership Academy of Wilmington (GLOW) is North Carolina’s first single-gender public charter school. Modeled after the highly successful schools in the Young Women’s Leadership Network, GLOW is dedicated to transforming the educational experience for 6th – 12th grade girls, creating future leaders and breaking the destructive cycle of poverty for many of our students.

MEDIA ADVISORY:
GLOW ACADEMY GRAND OPENING IS POSTPONED
Ribbon Cutting and Celebrity Chef Celebration to be Rescheduled
September 2, 2019 -- The Girls Leadership Academy of Wilmington is postponing its ribbon cutting and grand opening celebration in light of Hurricane Dorian. Originally planned for Thursday, September 5, all events will be rescheduled within the next two months. Participating celebrity chefs have committed to finding an alternative date and as soon as that date is determined, ticket holders will be notified.
“We are so grateful for our community’s support and for our chefs’ commitment to celebrate with us,” said GLOW President and CEO Todd Godbey. “We hope everyone will stay safe through this storm and we look forward to welcoming everyone to our new campus when hurricane season is behind us.”
